org.melior.util.collection

Class BoundedBlockingQueue<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.melior.util.collection.BoundedBlockingQueue<T>

  • public class BoundedBlockingQueue<T>
extends Object
    Implements a bounded blocking queue. When a caller attempts to add an item to the queue while the queue is full, then the caller is blocked until an item is removed from the queue. When a caller attempts to remove an item from the queue while the queue is empty, then the caller is blocked until an item is added to the queue.
    Since:
    2.3
    Author:
    Melior

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(T item)
            throws InterruptedException
        Add item to queue, if capacity is available. Otherwise, wait for item to be removed from queue.
        Parameters:
        item - The item
        Returns:
        true if the item was added, false otherwise
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

      • remove

        public T remove()
         throws InterruptedException
        Remove item from queue, if one is available. Otherwise, wait for item to be added to queue.
        Returns:
        The item
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

      • remove

        public T remove(long timeout,
                TimeUnit timeUnit)
         throws InterruptedException
        Remove item from queue, if one is available. Otherwise, wait for item to be added to queue.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The time to wait
        timeUnit - The time unit
        Returns:
        The item
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted
